intro: Eugeissona utilis, commonly known as the mountain savory, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats and is valued for its culinary and medicinal uses. Eugeissona utilis is also used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and digestive properties.
